author: manunlp
content:
With EIP-8025, will beacon nodes with staking duties be allowed to be stateless nodes?
(for attestations, sync committee and block proposals)

Currently, when proposing a block, a node opting-in for external block building (MEV) also builds a local block, and uses this local block if it is more lucrative than the one corresponding to the best bid offered by relays.

When proposing a block, a stateteless node won't be able to build block locally then.

author: jsign
content:
hey, I want to share some deep-dive into the sparse MPT implementation created by OpenVM (Axiom). Doing some benchmarks, they impl makes block proving ~16% faster than using the Risc0 optimized sparse-MPT implementation (which was already 20% faster than the stock Reth sparse-MPT). To be fair, Risc0 impl uses the current debug_executionWitness while OpenVM redesigned the guest input to allow these further improvements.
There are many cool tricks that I thought were worth explaining in more detail if someone is interested in knowing more about them: https://hackmd.io/@jsign/ethereum-zkvm-openvm-guest-input-and-optimized-mpt
